<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For a little tease of what to expect: We're not saying we interviewed <em>the</em> man of steel, but we did interview <em>a</em> man of steel...and he’s got some business chops on and off the silver screen.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/02/us-hiring-surges-march-bigger-rebound-sight?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Big Jobs Energy
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="You're hired image" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NjIxL3lvdV9yZV9oaXJlZF9pbWFnZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The March jobs report, released yesterday by the Labor Department, was like being on a 12-hour flight next to a crying baby when the captain says, “We have begun our descent.”  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The economy <a href="https://apnews.com/article/us-employers-add-916k-jobs-march-7fb625eacadc17dc03fb5353e3143200?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">added 916,000 jobs</a> in March, the biggest gain since last August and way up from the 468,000 added in February. The unemployment rate also ticked down from 6.2% to 6%, its lowest level since before the pandemic. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The biggest winners: </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Leisure and hospitality = 280,000 jobs added. Newton’s third law says that the sector that was battered the most during the pandemic also has the most to gain from a recovery. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Construction = 110,000. Brew readers know the housing market has been on fire since at least last summer, and in January home prices posted their </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/30/us-home-prices-hit-7year-high?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest annual gain</a></span><span> in 15 years.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Putting it in perspective</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Economists say this jobs report represents a turning point in the labor market’s road back to health. Because not only was this the third straight month of positive job growth...the future looks even brighter.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The vaccination rollout has ramped up, raising hopes that the public health crisis that forced businesses to close could come to an end in the next several months. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The economy basically just raised a $1.9 trillion Series E in the form of Biden’s stimulus plan. Flush with pandemic-era savings and additional $1,400 stimulus checks, consumers are </span><span><a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/consumer-confidence-soars-one-high-114211157.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ready to spend</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But we haven’t landed the plane yet. </strong>Of the 20+ million jobs lost in March and April of 2020, 8.4 million have yet to be recovered. And the number of Americans who’ve been out of work for at least six months increased last month.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>with the wind at his back, Biden wants to proceed full sail. The $2.3 trillion infrastructure proposal he introduced this week, literally called the American Jobs Plan, would <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-02/biden-says-infrastructure-plan-will-create-19-million-new-jobs?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">create 13.5 million jobs</a> by the end of his first term, as opposed to 11.4 million without the plan, per Moody’s Analytics. But with the GOP and corporate America wary of a tax hike, getting that done won’t be easy. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CIVIL RIGHTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/02/mlb-moves-allstar-game-georgia-voting-rights-law?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
MLB to Georgia: ✌
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Major League Baseball announced it was <a href="https://www.ajc.com/sports/atlanta-braves/mlb-will-move-all-star-game-out-of-atlanta/TCUEJPUPZZD2RCO3DY5OZH62OU/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">moving its All-Star Game</a> and the 2021 draft out of Georgia due to the state’s new restrictive voting law. The All-Star Game, which was supposed to take place at Atlanta’s Truist Park in July, had been planned since 2019, but the league said Georgia’s law is at odds with its values.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Commissioner Rob Manfred <a href="https://www.espn.com/mlb/story/_/id/31183822/mlb-moving-all-star-game-atlanta-georgia-voting-law?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">elaborated</a> on those values in a statement:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Major League Baseball fundamentally supports voting rights for all Americans and opposes restrictions to the ballot box. ...Fair access to voting continues to have our game's unwavering support."</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In response, Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp said the league's decision indicates that "cancel culture and woke political activists are coming for every aspect of your life, sports included."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>This week, GA-based corporations including Delta and Coca-Cola <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/31/72-black-executives-join-fight-protect-voting?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">came out forcefully</a> against the bill. But MLB’s is the first big action taken by a company in order to inflict economic pain on the state. We’ll see if others follow. </p>

COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/02/vaccine-tracker-april-3?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

Vaccine Tracker
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Vaccine tracker" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MjA0L3ZhY2NpbmVfdHJhY2tlci5KUEciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In the US…</strong>the latest numbers from the White House: <a href="https://www.sfchronicle.com/coronavirus/article/Coronavirus-live-updates-Bay-Area-sees-plunge-in-15993567.php?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">More than 100 million Americans</a> (almost a third of the population) have received their first dose of a coronavirus vaccine, and yesterday the US administered 3.975 million doses, a new daily record.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Around the world...</strong>150 countries have given more than 630 million doses. Nearly 50% of the UK population has received a first dose.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">More headlines</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Airplane mode: </strong>Vaccinated people just got the <a href="https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/danvergano/covid-travel-guidelines-cdc?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">all-clear</a> from the CDC to start traveling recreationally again, which is great news ahead of the busy Easter weekend. But the agency says to keep the mask on and practice social distancing.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Florida, man:</strong> Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis issued an executive order yesterday <a href="https://thehill.com/homenews/state-watch/546202-desantis-issues-executive-order-banning-vaccine-passports?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">banning</a> “vaccine passports,” or documents that prove vaccination. If anyone still wants to show off, Recode reports that <a href="https://www.vox.com/recode/22362371/etsy-sellers-vaccine-gear-fauci-ouchie-shot-fashion?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">vaccine-themed merch</a> is huge on Etsy right now.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
‘This Fabric Is Fab, Rick’
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="http://liveouter.com/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sp&utm_campaign=4.3.21" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Outer" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k5/3/v/60650bc8197ec.gif">

<img class="story-header-image" alt="Outer" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k5/3/v/60650bc8197ec.gif">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s what you’ll say to your pal, Richard, when you show him your <a href="http://liveouter.com/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sp&utm_campaign=4.3.21" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new outdoor sofa from Outer</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Outer set out to create outdoor furniture that was a triple threat: <strong style="color:#000">bed-comfy, indoor furniture-stylish, and camping gear-durable</strong>. Everyone said the necessary fabric didn’t exist...so Outer invented it. Outer’s performance fabric is <strong style="color:#000">stain, fade, and mold resistant</strong>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="http://liveouter.com/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sp&utm_campaign=4.3.21" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Outer’s patented OuterShell® technology</a> rolls out over the sofa to protect it from dirt and debris, so there’s always a dry, clean spot for Richard to sit. When the two of you settle in for a chat, you can just tuck the OuterShell behind a cushion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And...just in case Richard gets on your case about sustainability:<strong style="color:#000"> Outer uses materials from recycled plastic bottles</strong>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s a great time to invest in your home and an even better time to hang out on a comfy sofa in your backyard. <a href="http://liveouter.com/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sp&utm_campaign=4.3.21" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Do both with Outer</a>.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>At least 55 of the largest companies in the US, including Nike, FedEx, and Salesforce, paid no federal corporate income tax in the most recent fiscal year, per a <a href="https://itep.org/55-profitable-corporations-zero-corporate-tax/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">report</a> from the left-leaning research group Institute on Taxation and Economic Policy (ITEP). How’d they get around it? Government tax breaks, particularly from the 2017 tax bill and 2020’s CARES Act, according to ITEP.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“People underestimate the difficulty of scaling ‘vibe,’ where WeWork has a proven talent."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Prof. Scott Galloway lays out a <a href="https://www.profgalloway.com/we-might-work/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bull case</a> for WeWork, which is set to go public via SPAC at a $9 billion valuation. When WeWork initially tried to go public a few years ago at a valuation of $47 billion, Galloway said, “Any equity analyst who endorses this stock above a $10 billion valuation is lying, stupid, or both.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>This is a story about how I lost $10,000,000 by doing something stupid.<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>(<a href="https://twitter.com/awilkinson/status/1376985854229504007?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Andrew Wilkinson</a>)</p>

M&A
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/02/new-data-found-ma-boomed-q1?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Turns Out You Don’t Need Handshakes to Make a Deal
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/02/new-data-found-ma-boomed-q1" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="handshake" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=502 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/xT9DPIlGnuHpr2yObu/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->

<img class="story-header-image" alt="handshake" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/xT9DPIlGnuHpr2yObu/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Mergers and acquisitions did gangbusters last quarter, <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/global-deals-q1-int-idUSKBN2BN3DC?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">breaking</a> all-time Q1 records for global M&A and private equity-backed deals, according to Refinitiv.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The value of pending and completed global deals jumped 93% from Q1 2020, even though the number of deals only increased 6%. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>About half of M&A activity was US-based.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Private equity deals worldwide rose 116% from last year, making this PE’s strongest Q1 ever.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened? </strong>Super low borrowing costs, investors making up for lost time during the pandemic, and everyone’s favorite acronym. SPACs, or special purpose acquisition companies, accounted for ~28% of US dealmaking in the first quarter.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The largest SPAC deal to date </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/bacdf86f-e786-4439-966e-f5958adb1c59?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">happened</a></span><span> in February, when veteran investor Michael Klein’s SPAC took Lucid Motors public in a $24 billion deal.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>The current M&Amentum could slow down if SPAC mania stalls. The SEC is ramping up oversight and, since the start of last week, four deals were postponed, per Bloomberg.</p>

MUSIC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/02/hybe-acquires-scooter-brauns-ithaca-holdings-1-billion?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Scooter Braun Agrees to Dynamite Offer
</font></a>
</h1>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="BTS Dynamite" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=489 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/ibpyzXXfbiy1UkGRRO/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="BTS Dynamite" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/ibpyzXXfbiy1UkGRRO/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What do you get when you combine BTS, Ariana Grande, Justin Bieber, and Demi Lovato? One killer pop playlist, and now, a global powerhouse of a music company. HYBE acquired Ithaca Holdings for <a href="https://variety.com/2021/digital/news/hybe-formerly-big-hit-entertainment-acquires-scooter-brauns-ithaca-holdings-bringing-together-bts-justin-bieber-big-machine-1234943092/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">about $1 billion</a> yesterday, but unless you own some turntables, you might want a refresher on who these two audio giants are:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">HYBE </strong>is a South Korean music company formerly named Big Hit Entertainment. It manages a little-known group called BTS, as well as other rising K-pop artists like SEVENTEEN and TXT.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Ithaca Holdings</strong> is Scooter Braun’s multi-label music empire. It oversees a) SB Projects, which manages The Biebs, Grande, Lovato, and more, and b) the country-focused Big Machine Label Group, known in part for its terse breakup with Taylor Swift.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>A South Korean music company acquiring some of the US’s most prominent labels, instead of the other way around, is a sign that the entertainment industry has come out from the Hollywood sign’s shadow.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>HYBE has ambitions to be a lifestyle brand with its hands in travel, real estate, and more. It’s unclear exactly what that’ll look like, but if BTS’s rabid “Army” fan club backs it, it’ll be big.</p>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe March jobs report, released yesterday by the Labor Department, was like being on a 12-hour flight next to a crying baby when the captain says, “We have begun our descent.”  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe economy \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/us-employers-add-916k-jobs-march-7fb625eacadc17dc03fb5353e3143200?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadded 916,000 jobs\u003c/a\u003e in March, the biggest gain since last August and way up from the 468,000 added in February. The unemployment rate also ticked down from 6.2% to 6%, its lowest level since before the pandemic. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe biggest winners: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLeisure and hospitality = 280,000 jobs added. Newton’s third law says that the sector that was battered the most during the pandemic also has the most to gain from a recovery. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eConstruction = 110,000. Brew readers know the housing market has been on fire since at least last summer, and in January home prices posted their \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/30/us-home-prices-hit-7year-high?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebiggest annual gain\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in 15 years.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003ePutting it in perspective\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEconomists say this jobs report represents a turning point in the labor market’s road back to health. Because not only was this the third straight month of positive job growth...the future looks even brighter.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe vaccination rollout has ramped up, raising hopes that the public health crisis that forced businesses to close could come to an end in the next several months. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe economy basically just raised a $1.9 trillion Series E in the form of Biden’s stimulus plan. Flush with pandemic-era savings and additional $1,400 stimulus checks, consumers are \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/consumer-confidence-soars-one-high-114211157.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eready to spend\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut we haven’t landed the plane yet. \u003c/strong\u003eOf the 20+ million jobs lost in March and April of 2020, 8.4 million have yet to be recovered. And the number of Americans who’ve been out of work for at least six months increased last month.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ewith the wind at his back, Biden wants to proceed full sail. The $2.3 trillion infrastructure proposal he introduced this week, literally called the American Jobs Plan, would \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-02/biden-says-infrastructure-plan-will-create-19-million-new-jobs?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecreate 13.5 million jobs\u003c/a\u003e by the end of his first term, as opposed to 11.4 million without the plan, per Moody’s Analytics. But with the GOP and corporate America wary of a tax hike, getting that done won’t be easy. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emoving its All-Star Game\u003c/a\u003e and the 2021 draft out of Georgia due to the state’s new restrictive voting law. The All-Star Game, which was supposed to take place at Atlanta’s Truist Park in July, had been planned since 2019, but the league said Georgia’s law is at odds with its values.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCommissioner Rob Manfred \u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/mlb/story/_/id/31183822/mlb-moving-all-star-game-atlanta-georgia-voting-law?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eelaborated\u003c/a\u003e on those values in a statement:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“Major League Baseball fundamentally supports voting rights for all Americans and opposes restrictions to the ballot box. ...Fair access to voting continues to have our game's unwavering support.\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn response, Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp said the league's decision indicates that \"cancel culture and woke political activists are coming for every aspect of your life, sports included.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThis week, GA-based corporations including Delta and Coca-Cola \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/31/72-black-executives-join-fight-protect-voting?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecame out forcefully\u003c/a\u003e against the bill. But MLB’s is the first big action taken by a company in order to inflict economic pain on the state. #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebreaking\u003c/a\u003e all-time Q1 records for global M\u0026A and private equity-backed deals, according to Refinitiv.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe value of pending and completed global deals jumped 93% from Q1 2020, even though the number of deals only increased 6%. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAbout half of M\u0026A activity was US-based.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePrivate equity deals worldwide rose 116% from last year, making this PE’s strongest Q1 ever.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened? \u003c/strong\u003eSuper low borrowing costs, investors making up for lost time during the pandemic, and everyone’s favorite acronym. SPACs, or special purpose acquisition companies, accounted for ~28% of US dealmaking in the first quarter.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe largest SPAC deal to date \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/bacdf86f-e786-4439-966e-f5958adb1c59?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehappened\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in February, when veteran investor Michael Klein’s SPAC took Lucid Motors public in a $24 billion deal.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eThe current M\u0026Amentum could slow down if SPAC mania stalls.
